alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 17 at 12:35PM CST until February 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow at times earlt this afternoon then snow gradually diminshing late this afternoon. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph may further reduce visibilities in open areas. * WHERE...McDonough and Hancock Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...The combination if falling snow and blowing snow may reduce visibilitiy to near zero at times. These hazardous conditions may impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong north winds and temperatures in the 20s will result in wind chills in single digits above zero this afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 for Iowa, or by visiting 511ia.org, modot.org, or idot.Illinois.gov.
